intro: Sphaeralcea munroana subsp. subrhomboidea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert and semi-desert environments. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its adaptability to arid conditions. The subspecies is distinguished by its more elongated leaves and slightly different flower structure compared to other subspecies of Sphaeralcea munroana.
